subject: Re: [junit] Anyway to dynamically change name of test passed  to formatter?
msgSnippet: My situation is to build your test suite manually, then change your test case class constructor to accept the parameters that you need to take. suite() {
messageBody:
My situation is to build your test suite manually, then change your test case class' constructor to accept the parameters that you need to take.

suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();

loop somehow {
suite.addTest(new ParameterizedTestCase(param1, param2, ...));
}

return suite;
}

ParameterizedTestCase(param1, param2, ...) {
super(makeSuiteName(param1, param2, ...));
this.param1 = param1;
...
}

static String makeSuiteName(...) {
return "ParameterizedTestCase<" + param1 + ", " + param2 + ... + ">";
}

The key points are these:

* Build your test suite by looping over the set of parameters you need to pass.
* Code a method to build a meaningful test case name from your parameters.
* Code your constructor to accept all the parameters your test needs.
* Store the parameters in the test's fixture.
* Code your test methods normally.

That should help you get on your way.
